author: Han Kang (sample)
text: Hands learn a gentleness that language forgot; the body remembers what the city refused to name.

author: Han Kang (sample)
text: In the kitchen light, the smallest kindness alters the fate of an evening, like a tide turning in a cup.

author: Han Kang (sample)
text: Silence grows roots; a person chooses not to wound the world and begins to heal herself.

author: Han Kang (sample)
text: The day does not end; it keeps pressing until breath becomes a thread you refuse to cut.

author: L. Krasznahorkai (sample)
text: A wind without memory crosses the plain; the village waits, suspended between ruin and routine.

author: L. Krasznahorkai (sample)
text: Men circle the same street as if time were a rope; persistence is the only proof that they exist.

author: L. Krasznahorkai (sample)
text: Care appears like a brief lantern in fog, insufficient yet real against the collapse.

author: L. Krasznahorkai (sample)
text: Everything continues despite itself; endurance is the discipline of staying after meaning has left.
